title: Doesn't work on Windows 10 Mobile with OpenGL backend
body: Both the official sample app (https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/store/p/skiasharp-for-windows/9nblggh51856) and our own SkiaSharp based application shows only a white screen on Windows 10 Mobile with OpenGL backend.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Interesting... Could you share device specs? And what versions of DirectX are on those devices?

SkiaSharp for UWP uses DirectX instead of OpenGL, and works on my test devices. But it may be the case that I need to adjust some of the DX context options.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I think I managed to find a device that has the same issue: Lumia 435. I get a blank white screen.

I am having a look to see what is going on, but it appears to be an issue with the way the context is initialized.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Some more investigation: There appears to be a problem with my offscreen buffer with the lower-end devices. The Lumia 435 appears to use DX9.3. If I force the drawing to FBO 0, then the image is visible, but if I draw to FBO 1, and then blit that to FBO 0, nothing appears. 

Because it works on both my Lumia 950XL and SurfaceBook, I think the fallback to DX9 may cause some change somewhere that results in the buffers not working as expected.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I am closing this as this is no longer something that is going to be supported in the future. Windows 10 Mobile is really no more.

I believe that I have "fixed" the real cause of he underlying GL issue with the rewrite of the UWP views, but I have also changed the way libSkiaSharp.dll builds for UWP. As a result, it no longer runs on the old Windows Phones. It still works on my Lumia 950 XL, so it is nothing to do with the ARM component, but rather somewhere it id causing one of the dependencies not to be loaded.

If someone really needs UWP for Windows 10 Mobile, we need to open a new issue and hopefully the community can help out. From the side of the SkiaSharp team, we feel that the deprecated Mobile platform is not a priority at this point in time.
